sections.text:
Supporting Information
Assessing cytotoxic activities, theoretical and in silico molecular docking calculations of
phthalocyanines bearing cinnamyloxy-groups
Özge Özten, Aleksey E. Kuznetsov, Mustafa Gokce, Sultan Erkan, Emrah Bulut ,
Omer Suat Taskin, Belma Zengin Kurt, Mustafa Zahid Yıldız, Lukasz Sobotta, Emre Güzel *
* Corresponding Author: Emre Güzel
Tel.: +90-264-616-04-29 E-mail address: eguzel@subu.edu.tr
S1
1. Materials
All reagents and solvents were of reagent-grade quality obtained from commercial suppliers. The homogeneity of the products was tested in each step by TLC. The solvents were stored over molecular sieves. All solvents were dried and purified as described by Perrin and Armarego [1].
2. Equipment
IR spectra were recorded on a Perkin Elmer Spectrum One FT-IR (ATR sampling accessory) spectrophotometer and electronic spectra on Shimadzu UV-1280 spectrophotometer. Mass analyses were recorded on a Bruker MALDI-TOF (Matrix-Assisted Laser Desorption/Ionization-Time-Of-Flight mass, Rheinstetten, Germany) spectrometer using alpha-cyano-4-hydroxy-cinnamic acid (CHCA) and dithranol (DIT) as matrix materials. Elemental analyses were performed at the Institute of Marine Science and Management, İstanbul University.

Figure S7. Sextet structure of the phthalocyanine 7, optimized at the B3LYP/Lanl2dz level in the implicit THF. Selected bond distances are given in Å, bond angles and dihedral angles are given in degrees. Color coding: brown for C, light grey for H, blue for N, bright green for Mn.
S7
Figure S8. Singlet structures of the phthalocyanines 2 (a), 3 (b), and 4 (c), optimized at the B3LYP/631G* (B3LYP/Gen) level in the implicit THF. Selected bond distances are given in Å, bond angles and dihedral angles are given in degrees. Color coding: brown for C, light grey for H, blue for N, dark grey for Ga, light blue for In, bright green for Cl.
